data.name: Orbita-Fuensalida misión
data.desc: Franciscan friars Orbita and Fuensalida appointed for a misión to Ma towns by Lake Peten Itza
data.locn: Merida, Tekax, Bacalar, Hondo, New, New R Lagoon, Labouring Creek, Old, Tipuj, Lake Peten Itza
data.agents_sp: Juan de Orbita, Bartolomé de Fuensalida, Juan de Acevedo, Gonzalo de Salazar, Gregorio Marín de Aguilar, Andrés Carillo de Pernia
data.agents_nsp0: Cristóbal Na, Isabel Pech, Francisco Cumux
data.agents_nsp1: Can Ek, Capt Ah Chata Pol, Capt Ahau Puc
data.note:
There were some 100 vecinos in all in Tipu, suggesting a total population of about 340 /v Jones 139 /[missg]
 1616-1617 Fr Juan de Orbita visits Nojpeten, and possibly or likely is received by Can Ek /v Graham 243 /v Jones 134, 152 /[missg]
 1619 Frays Fuensalida, Orbita, and [non-Fray?] Gregorio de Aguilar return to Nojpeten via Tipu, encounter resurgence of idolatry at Tipu; proselytising purpose of visit to Nojpeten foiled by Can Ek's wife /v Graham 244 /v Jones 18-19, 148-149 /[missg]
